sections.experimental setup for evaluation of ent:
This section gives an outline of the experimental conditions for evaluating EnSGD and
the details are provided in the supplementary materials.
Our experimental codes are based on source codes provided by Wu et¬†al. [ref]32,
and our implementations of EnSGD are based on the codes provided by Chaudhari et¬†al. [ref]3.
Datasets of the experiments were CIFAR10, CIFAR100¬†[ref]19, and SVHN¬†.
We compared the convergences of adversarial training when using SGD and EnSGD.
In addition, we evaluated the combination of EnSGD and AWP¬†[ref]32,
which injects adversarial noise into the parameter to flatten the loss landscape.
We used ResNet-18 (RN18)¬† and WideResNet-34-10 (WRN)¬† following¬†[ref]32.
We used PGD,
and the hyperparameters for PGD were based on¬†[ref]32.

The learning rates of SGD and EnSGD are set to 0.1 and divided by 10 at the 100-th and 150-th epoch,
and we used early stopping by evaluating test robust accuracies against PGD (20-iteration).
The hyperparameter of AWP is tuned in {0.01,0.005}0.010.005\{0.01,0.005\}.
For WRN, we used the same hyperparameters as those of RN18.
We trained models three times and
show the average and standard deviation of test accuracies.
Note that we evaluated EnSGD for adversarial training since our analysis focuses on adversarial training
and also confirmed the effectiveness of EnSGD in TRADES¬†, which is also used for adversarial robustness.
The evaluation is provided in the supplementary materials.
